description: An old (Middle English) aphetic form of apprentice: that is, a form which lost the unstressed initial vowel a and reduced the initial double pp to a single p.

examples: Faith, bind him prentice to a lord; by the same rule he'll be a lord when he's out of his time.

verbs.description: prentice (third-person singular simple present prentices, present participle prenticing, simple past and past participle prenticed)
